org.restsql.core

Interface ColumnMetaData


  • public interface ColumnMetaData
    Encapsulates column (or field) metadata of an SQL Resource.
    Author:
    Mark Sawers
    See Also:
    SqlResource, TableMetaData

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getColumnLabel()
      Returns column label, a string identified in double quotes after columns in the select clause in the SQL Resource definition query.
      String getColumnName()
      Returns column name, as it is known by the database.
      int getColumnNumber()
      Returns column number in the in the select clause in the SQL Resource definition query.
      int getColumnType()
      Returns column type from java.sql.Types.
      String getColumnTypeName()
      Returns column type name as given by the database JDBC driver.
      String getDatabaseName()
      Returns database name.
      String getQualifiedTableName()
      Returns fully qualified table name in database-specific form for use in SQL statements.
      String getTableName()
      Returns table name.
      boolean isCharType()
      Returns true if column is a character string, for example char or varchar.
      boolean isDateTimeType()
      Returns true if column is a date, time or timestamp.
      boolean isNonqueriedForeignKey()
      Returns true for foreign key columns not declared in the SQL Resource query but added by the framework.
      boolean isPrimaryKey()
      Returns true if the column is a primary key.
      boolean isReadOnly()
      Returns true if the column is read-only, for example derived from SQL function or a database view.

    • Method Detail

      • getDatabaseName

        String getDatabaseName()
        Returns database name.

      • getColumnLabel

        String getColumnLabel()
        Returns column label, a string identified in double quotes after columns in the select clause in the SQL Resource definition query.

      • getColumnName

        String getColumnName()
        Returns column name, as it is known by the database.

      • getColumnNumber

        int getColumnNumber()
        Returns column number in the in the select clause in the SQL Resource definition query.

      • getColumnType

        int getColumnType()
        Returns column type from java.sql.Types.
        Returns:
        java.sql.Types constant
        See Also:
        Types

      • getColumnTypeName

        String getColumnTypeName()
        Returns column type name as given by the database JDBC driver.

      • getQualifiedTableName

        String getQualifiedTableName()
        Returns fully qualified table name in database-specific form for use in SQL statements. MySQL uses the form database.table, for example sakila.film. PostgreSQL uses the form database.schema.table, for example sakila.public.film.

      • getTableName

        String getTableName()
        Returns table name.

      • isCharType

        boolean isCharType()
        Returns true if column is a character string, for example char or varchar.

      • isDateTimeType

        boolean isDateTimeType()
        Returns true if column is a date, time or timestamp.

      • isNonqueriedForeignKey

        boolean isNonqueriedForeignKey()
        Returns true for foreign key columns not declared in the SQL Resource query but added by the framework. These are required for writes to child extensions, parent extensions and and one-to-many child tables.

      • isPrimaryKey

        boolean isPrimaryKey()
        Returns true if the column is a primary key.

      • isReadOnly

        boolean isReadOnly()
        Returns true if the column is read-only, for example derived from SQL function or a database view.
